title: Felonious branding; penalty
context: §142-48 Felonious branding; penalty. Whoever wilfully and feloniously brands, or otherwise marks, any kine, horse, mule, sheep, goat, or other cattle belonging to another, with one&rsquo;s mark, or with the mark of another not the owner of the animal so branded or marked, with the intent to convert it to one&rsquo;s own use, or to the use of another shall be imprisoned not more than one year, or fined not more than $200 for each kine, horse, mule, sheep, goat or other cattle thus branded or marked. [PC 1869, c 25, §1; am L 1903, c 12, §1; RL 1925, §688; RL 1935, §266; RL 1945, §1075; RL 1955, §20-47; HRS §142-48; gen ch 1985] Case Notes Brand of itself not conclusive evidence of ownership; law regulating brands does not apply to wild herds roaming Maunakea. 2 H. 367.
